alert.note: Alert for Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 11:10AM EST until February 18 at 5:06PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers... Licking River in Ohio below Newark. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Licking River in Ohio below Newark. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, A few inches of water covers Nathaniel Avenue, Forry Street near the 200 block, the Babe Ruth ball diamonds. Some low-lying areas near Little Texas and Summit Road east of Newark incur minor flooding, as well as Sleepy Hollow Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 14.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM EST Friday was 15.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 4.6 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to developments by listening to NOAA Weather Radio. For additional details on river forecasts, visit water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=iln
